intro: Chamaemelum szowitzii, commonly known as the Szóczki's chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flower heads that are surrounded by white ray florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
